page.title: 10The A45 at Bury St. Edmunds
page.content: The A45 is a busy dual carriageway running from the A1 at St.Neots to Ipswich. The current M.P. for Bury St. Edmunds calls it "the highway to Europe". To the northwest of Bury St.Edmunds it passes through farmland within sight of the railway which runs closely parallel to the south. There is a large roundabout with an underpass, where minor roads to the villages of Westley and Fornham All Saints and a main road to Bury St. Edmunds leave the A45. On Monday 8th July, a mid-morning traffic census of half-an-hour recorded as travelling east:- 256 cars,80 lorries, 37 vans, 2 coaches, 2 motorcycles and 1 bicycle. Travelling west were:- 225 cars, 79 lorries, 57 vans, 5 coaches, 3 motorcycles and 1 tractor.
